channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drain blocked, 13th February
item.description:
Drain is completely blocked and after a rain, the water pools around here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sunset Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 potholes near traffic calming area, 13th February
item.description:
1 on the verge is deep. 1 has white paint around but not to cover all the problem near centre white line on carriageway. 1 difficult to avoid when busy with traffic

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain is completely filled with silt., 13th February
item.description:
The drain outside of Wheel Gates is completely blocked with silt. The impact is that water run off is now going down the street, putting some houses further down Southam Lane at flood risk.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southam Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large, deep pothole, I thought was puddle, couldnt avoid, because of oncoming trafffic, burst my tyre, Ford Fiesta £97!, 13th February
item.description:
Near to the Auction Centre, before Church
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Every year verge turned to mud bath, 13th February
item.description:
Verge Outside 10 Mead Road. GL53 7DT Every year the verge is turned into a mud bath by vehicles pulling onto it to pass one another. Could the limited parking yellow line be carried on around the corner so traffic can see one another/ pass one another. Alternatively is it allowed to put a large white boulder on the verge to stop people driving over it? You will also notice that this piece of road is not breaking up completely following constant pot hole repair. Is it possible to have it properly relaid? Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Mead Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 190 mm deep 4 metre long pot hole, 13th February
item.description:
It’s the massive section of the road that is no longer there. Impossible to miss to be honest.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury

item.title: 90 mm pot hole, 13th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham

item.title: 135mm deep pot hole and road sign from last year still dumped in hedgerow, 13th February

item.title: On corner of Highland Road & Park Road, 13th February

item.title: Pothole in middle of road, 13th February
item.description:
Large pothole in centre of road by the white line near to the first house as you turn into North Road West. This has been recently repaired and failed pretty much immediately.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Road West, Golden Valley, Cheltenham
